{{JP|'''Mod Powers'''|MOD能力|Moddo Nōryoku|lead=yes}}, also called {{JP|'''Cursed Mods'''|呪いのMOD|Noroi no Moddo}} by [[Gray (character)|Gray]], are intrinsic special abilities appearing in ''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]''. They appear to be hereditary, allowing the users to manipulate the world around them in ways impossible within typical iterations of ''Minecraft''.

== Symptoms ==
Those affected by Mod Powers have {{JP|Mod Runes|MODの紋章|Moddo no Monshō}} somewhere on their bodies, which differ in appearance and placement for each ability.

Zombie Curse Mod Rune.png|The Zombie Curse's Mod Rune, located on the upper left arm.<ref name="v2 notes"/>

Evolution Mod Rune.png|Evolution's Mod Rune, located on the center of the torso.<ref name="v2 notes"/>
Blizzard Mod Rune.png|Blizzard's Mod Rune, located over the left eye.<ref name="v3 notes">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Volume 3, Character Wiki</ref>
Mirror Seed Mod Rune.png|Mirror Seed's Mod Rune, located on the right arm.<ref name="v3 notes"/>
Mob Tamer Mod Rune.png|Mob Tamer's Mod Rune, located above the right eye.<ref name="v3 notes"/>
Block Piercer Mod Rune.png|Block Piercer's Mod Rune, located on the upper right arm.<ref name="v3 notes"/>
Clairvoyance Mod Rune.png|Clairvoyance's Mod Rune, located on the left pupil.<ref name="v3 notes"/>

== Types ==

=== Imagination ===
{{JP|Imagination|創造力|Sōzō-ryoku}}, used by [[Nico White|Nico]] and [[Icco White]], allows the user to craft in variable sized crafting grids, even without the use of a [[Crafting Table|crafting table]]. In addition to normal items (such as a [[Wooden Sword|wooden sword]]), it can be used to craft items invented by the user;<ref name="c1">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 1, "Nico's Adventure Begins!"</ref> due to the versatility of what it creates, it can even be used to mimic [[enchantments]].<ref name="c10">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 10, "Friends Must Be Protected!"</ref> Both Nico and Icco have been shown to create various things:

; [[Nico White|Nico]]'s creations:
<ul style="columns: 2">
* [[Ultra-Long Stone Sword]]
* [[Wooden Whirlwind Shuriken]]
* A giant [[bucket]], crafted in a 5x5 grid with four iron ingots on either side and three at the bottom.
* [[Zombie Counter Trap]]
* A giant [[diamond shield]], crafted by filling all but four slots in a 5x5 crafting grid with diamonds to create a skull shape. Nico used it in his battle against [[Yamabuki]], allowing Gray to barely shoot the ninja using his bow.<ref name="c5">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 5, "The Twin-Blade Ninja's Challenge!"</ref>
* [[Ultra-Fine Iron Wire]]
* A [[fishing rod]] with a doll of himself as a lure, crafted with a fishing rod and two logs, one diagonally below the rod and the other below the first log. Nico used it to lure [[Dylan]]'s brother, recently turned into a [[drowned]], to the water's surface.<ref name="c7">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 7, "Battle on the High Seas!"</ref>
* Water [[armor]], crafted by forming a [[chestplate]] with [[water bucket]]s. When worn, it resembles water floating around the user. Nico used it to save [[Phoenix (character)|Phoenix]] when he fell into his village’s lava pit.<ref name="c8">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 8, "First Festival, Then Treasure!"</ref>
* [[Ultra-Long Iron Sword]]
* [[Blast Blade]]
* [[Giant Snowball]]
* [[Hammer of Destruction]]
* [[Artificial Sun]]
* [[Cutting Iron Fist]]
* [[Tasty Cobblestone Block]]
* [[Halberd]]
* Exploding boots, crafted by adding [[gunpowder]] under his boots. When worn, they allow the user to create mini explosions beneath their feet to propel them forward, allowing them to temporarily keep up with an [[enderman]]'s teleporting.<ref name="c18">''[[Minecraft: the Manga]]'' Chapter 18, "Clash with the Mighty Enderman!!"</ref>
* [[Chain Sickle]]
</ul>
; [[Icco]]'s creations:
* [[Obsidian Twin Blades]]
* [[Cactus Blast]]
* Exploding arrows, which he would give to [[Owl (character)|Owl]] to use<ref name="c15">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 15, "Icco White's Past!"</ref>

The size of the crafting grid that each person can use is defined by the level of the Mod Power. With Imagination I, a 5x5 crafting grid can be used,<ref name="c1"/> while Imagination II grants a 6x6 crafting grid. Additionally, users of Imagination can combine their crafting grids to form larger, rectangular grids. Both Nico and Icco have access to Imagination II,<ref>''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 59</ref> though when Nico first awakens his Mod Power he is limited to Imagination I.<ref name="c1"/>

=== Zombie Curse ===
The {{JP|Zombie Curse|ゾンビ化の呪い|Zonbi-ka no Noroi}} is a Mod Power that transforms people into [[zombie]]s, in both body and mind.<ref name="v2 notes"/> Gray and his village are afflicted by it.<ref name="c2">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 2, "A New Friend!"</ref>

=== Growth ===
{{JP|Growth|成長期|Seichō-ki}} is a Mod Power that allows the user to become stronger, more intelligent, and larger the more creatures they eat. It was used by a Giant Spider that attacked [[Carhon Village]], eating enough of the village's livestock to grow to 30 times the size of an average [[spider]] and to gain enough intelligence for basic speech.<ref name="c6"/>

=== Evolution ===
{{JP|Evolution|<ruby>道化<rt>しんか</rt></ruby>|Shinka}} is a Mod Power used by [[Navy]]. It grants superior intelligence that rivals or surpasses that of humans, as well as extremely strong legs and [[blast protection]], allowing them to survive explosions unharmed.<ref name="v2 notes"/>

=== Blizzard ===
{{JP|Blizzard|吹雪|Fubuki}} is a Mod Power used by the [[Blizzard Stray]]. It creates a constant blizzard around the user, spanning many kilometers.<ref name="v3 notes"/>

=== Mirror Seed ===
{{JP|Mirror Seed|コピーシード|Kopī Shīdo}} is a Mod Power used by [[Don Gold]]. By touching others' Mod Runes, the user can create a seed that grants their Mod Power for 10 minutes when eaten.<ref>''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 12, "Bad-Guy Town Ahead!"</ref>

Don Gold has used Mirror Seed to copy the following Mod Powers:
*{{JP|Iron Nugget Gun|鉄快弾|Tetsukai-dan}}: The ability to shoot [[iron nugget]]s.

=== Mob Tamer ===
{{JP|Mob Tamer|魔物使い|Mamono Tsukai}} is a Mod Power used by [[Hyena (character)|Hyena]]. It allows the user to control any mob they can see, provided the mob is weaker than themselves; in Hyena's case, this includes [[Zombie]]s and [[Skeleton]]s. Due to the user's control over the mobs, they seem very resistant to damage, though they actually just ignore any damage they incur to prioritize the user's orders.<ref name="c14">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 14, "The Blow to Crush Evil!"</ref>

=== Block Piercer ===
{{JP|Block Piercer|ブロック貫通|Burokku Kantsū}} is a Mod Power that allows the user to instantly punch through any block, even those that are generally unbreakable.<ref name="c19">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 19, "They're Back! Platinum vs. Ruby!"</ref> It is used by [[Platinum (character)|Platinum]].<ref name="c14"/>

When attacking through an iron wall created by [[Nico White|Nico]], Platinum refers to her punch as {{JP|'''Iron Punch'''|アイアンパンチ|Aian Panchi}}.<ref name="c19"/>

=== Clairvoyance ===
{{JP|Clairvoyance|千里眼|Senrigan}} is a Mod Power that allows the user to see anywhere in the world that they've been before. It also grants the user the ability to see through walls, floors, and other matter, though the extent of it is limited. It is used by [[Owl (character)|Owl]].<ref name="c15"/>

=== Replication ===
{{JP|Replication|増殖|Zōshoku}} is a Mod Power that allows the user to replicate themselves endlessly. It is used by the [[Replicating Silverfish]] who, due to their limited intelligence, replicating themselves into a swarm that was stuck constantly searching for more food to feed itself.<ref name="c16">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 16, "More Food, Stat!"</ref>

=== Cat King ===
{{JP|Cat King|猫の王|Neko no Ō}} is a Mod Power that grants its users heightened senses and super strength.<ref name="v4 notes"/> It is used by [[Hunter (character)|Hunter]], a member of [[Don Gold's Crew]].<ref name="c19"/>

=== Barrier Block ===
{{JP|Barrier Block|バリアブロック|Baria Burokku}} is a Mod Power that allows its user to create [[barrier]]s at will. It is used by [[Ruby (character)|Ruby]], a member of Don Gold's Crew.

While Barrier Block is generally impossible to avoid due to barriers' unbreakable nature, this can be nullified by [[#Block Piercer|Block Piercer]].

Ruby has one named technique, {{JP|'''Ghost Cage'''|ゴーストケージ|Gōsuto Kēji}}, in which she suddenly surrounds an opponent with barriers.<ref name="c19"/>

=== The King's Mod ===
The {{JP|King's Mod|王のMOD|Ō no Moddo}} is a Mod Power that the [[Evil King's Gang]] want to use to destroy the world.<ref>''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Volume 11, Character Introductions</ref>

=== Teleport Command===
The {{JP|Teleport Command|テレポートコマンド|Terepōto Komando}} is a Mod Power that allows the user to use the [[Commands/teleport|/tp]] command to teleport themselves or others (through direct contact) to specified [[coordinates]]. It is used by [[Calamity]].<ref name="c57">''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 57</ref>

=== Enlargement ===
{{JP|Enlargement|広域化|Kōiki-ka}} is a Mod Power stored in a [[wither skeleton skull]]. It was one of three used by [[Abyss]] when creating the ultimate [[Wither]].<ref name="c57"/>

=== Power Amplification ===
{{JP|Power Amplification|<ruby>威力增大<rt>いりょくぞうだい</rt></ruby>|Iriyokuzōdai}} is a Mod Power stored in a wither skeleton skull. It was one of three used by [[Abyss]] when creating the ultimate Wither.<ref name="c57"/>

=== Forced Fusion ===
{{JP|Forced Fusion|強制融合|Kyōsei Yūgō}} is a Mod Power stored in a wither skeleton skull that allows the user to forcibly fuse others. It was one of three used by Abyss when creating the ultimate Wither, which he created by fusing a Mod Power-infused Wither, himself, and [[Icco White]].<ref name="c57"/> The one who activated the fusion appears to remain in control once fused, as Abyss remained in control of the ultimate Wither. The only way to unfuse somebody is to kill them; however, they are still eligible to be revived with a [[totem of undying]], and will remain unfused afterwards.<ref>''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 58</ref>

=== One Block ===
{{JP|One Block|ワンブロック|Wan Burokku}} is the ability to create a palm-sized pocket dimension, containing a single [[grass block]], and to trap others inside. It is used by an unnamed pickpocket.<ref>''[[Minecraft: The Manga]]'' Chapter 61</ref>
